Low-key eyeshadow for a modern look
description: If you don’t want to look like a backing singer in an 80s music video, treat your eyeshadow with a light touchBack in the day I never understood eyeshadows. That was when people would use a million shades and textures and resemble extras on a dodgy 80s music video. These days, neutrals offer a really modern approach to eye (and lip) makeup. The low-key shades of taupes, browns and plums are perfect for anyone who shies away from complex eyeshadow looks and wants ease – I tend to use just fingers to be honest(with a cotton bud dipped in makeup remover on standby). And they are easy on the eye – yours and everyone else’s.1. Ilia The Necessary Eyeshadow Palette £40, iliabeauty.com 2. Blink Brow Bar x Priya Alhuwalia Eyebrow Pencil £22, bbb-london.com 3. Pucci x Guerlain Powder £68, guerlain.com 4. Jones Road Lip and Cheek Palette £28, jonesroadbeauty.com 5. Lisa Eldridge Rouge Experience Refillable Lipstick £49, lisaeldridge.com Continue reading...
author: Funmi Fetto

title: Trevor Sorbie obituary
description: Celebrity hairdresser known for his pioneering 1970s styles the Wedge and the ScrunchAfter Vidal Sassoon changed the look of women’s hair with his radical geometric cuts in the early 1960s, variants of his original shapes prevailed. Short cuts kept close to a head’s profile, longer bobs swung in movement but dropped straight as a curtain at rest.Then in 1974, Sassoon’s young artistic director, Trevor Sorbie, saw how a model’s locks fell full and chunky as he pulled a brush through them, and, impromptu, cut that shape into her hair. This was 3D geometry. Voila, the Wedge, so striking that Vogue allotted it an unprecedented double-page spread. The cut was imitated worldwide, an emblem of the 70s like the platform soles and wide flares it balanced. Continue reading...

title: The 36 Best Free People Gifts For Each Friend On Your List
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. This holiday season, we’ve found the gifts that feel great to get and even better to give. Shop Well-Received, our collection of editor-approved holiday gift guides, here.Is your holiday shopping list growing by the second? One minute you’re browsing new palettes for make-up-loving friends who love a good beauty bundle, and the next you’re scouring the internet for budget-friendly luxuries sure to dazzle your partner. And then there are those hard-to-shop-for folks — the ones with very specific tastes and surprise favorites that always leave you doing that “never-saw-that-coming” head scratch. Where on earth to start with them?  Luckily, Free People’s Gift Shop is here to save the day, packed with perfect finds for everyone on your list, from cute home decor and cozy accessories to pet sweaters that’ll make any furry friend (read: child) the star of holiday photos. Since gifting can feel overwhelming with endless options out there, we’ve streamlined Free People‘s holiday lineup into an edit for all personality types. Think: hostess with the mostest, the yoga master, homebodies, and festive fanatics). From under-$50 gifts to splurge-worthy picks if you’ve got some cheese to spend, you’ll uncover presents that fit your budget and are practically guaranteed to spark a squeal on unwrapping day. Happy gifting! DashDividers_1_500x100 For The Cozy Homebody Whether your friend loves a good pajama set and slippers or prefers a throw blanket and festive candles to warm up their space, Free People has two bundles that make holiday shopping a breeze. And if they’re the one who’s cold and excessively layered, check out the retailer’s accessories, from scarves to beanies. Shop all Free People gifts DashDividers_1_500x100 For The Festive Fanatic Does your giftee decks the halls and tree-trims like it’s sport? Well, then Free People’s holiday decor is a literal haven. From fun food-shaped ornaments to quirky tree toppers, there’s something for every vibe, whether they’re all about cozy charm or live for glitz and sparkle. Shop all Free People gifts DashDividers_1_500x100 For The Zen-Obsessed Yogi If your yoga-loving friend seems stuck in a black leggings rut, gift them a fresh workout set that brings a pop of color to their flow. Think vibrant leggings, a bold sports bra, or a cozy thermal for layering. And if you want to skip the guesswork on sizing, FP Movement has accessories like gym bags and yoga blocks that’ll take their practice to the next level. Shop all Free People gifts DashDividers_1_500x100 For The Host With The Most Every group has a Monica Geller — the one who assembles the perfect charcuterie board and has picture-perfect home decor. Show your appreciation with a gift as detail-oriented as they are, like a playful candle that references an inside joke or a conversation-starting match cloche (so chic). Shop all Free People gifts DashDividers_1_500x100 For The Trendsetter If your giftee is devoted to rocking the latest trends, you’re in the right place. Free People’s holiday assortment has all the current cravings, from structured barrel-leg denim to (maybe ludicrously capacious) slouchy totes they’ll proudly parade. Shop all Free People gifts DashDividers_1_500x100 For The Adoring Pet Parent Who deserves gifts the most? Fur babies. For friends who treat their cats and dogs like children, Free People’s array of pet apparel, accessories, and toys is downright irresistible. Why not throw in a little coordination with matching jackets or a luxe carrier so they can both travel in style? Shop all Free People gifts Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?24 Free People Gifts That Are Utterly Dashing16 Secret Santa Gifts Under $25 For Everyone6 R29 Editors Try FP Movement’s Bestselling Fleece
author: Vivien Lee

title: Refinery29 Loves: Everything To See & Shop In November
description: Welcome to Refinery29 Loves, the monthly news bulletin where you’ll find the best things to shop and see in fashion and beauty right now.With our Halloween outfits and vampy makeup locked away for another year, our heads are now firmly turning towards the practical parts of our wardrobe that work for all weather eventualities. Think striped sweaters, blanket scarves, and heavy-duty boots. But staying warm doesn’t mean dressing like you’re about to climb a mountain.This season, plenty of It Girls are inspiring our freezing fashion looks for the winter months ahead. For those seeking a chic and refined look, the Olsen twins remain superior thanks to their arsenal of tailored coats, turtlenecks, and classic loafers. If you want a cozier option, Katie Holmes is an ideal reference point for slouchy cardigans, well-fitting jeans, and low-heeled leather boots. A more elevated approach would be Taylor Russell, our inspo for all-out cold-girl glamor with caramel-colored coats, faux fur scarves, and gold statement jewelry. Then there’s makeup, and it’s safe to say that we’re embracing all things warm and glossy. Hailey Bieber is leading the mood board with a pumpkin spice-inspired lip and glowy peach cheeks. And for hair makeovers, we can’t take our eyes off Rihanna’s curls, dyed a very seasonal shade of autumn leaf. To uncover all the new fashion and beauty launches that are giving us even more inspiration this November, click through the slideshow ahead…Disney x Lululemon Good vibes await courtesy of the new Disney x Lululemon collab, which finds your favorite comfy pieces from the activewear brand adorned with playful Mickey Mouse motifs. The Happily Ever After collection includes Disney-fied versions of the cult-loved Align leggings, an oversized fleece hoodie, a bright pink Energy Longline sports bra, the viral Everywhere Belt Bag, a textured bucket hat with Mickey ears, and so much more. Prices range from $34 to $158.Shop now at LululemonDisney x Lululemon Warm Revelation Beanie, $, available at LululemonDisney x Lululemon Fleece Oversized Hoodie, $, available at LululemonDisney x Lululemon Everywhere Belt Bag 1L Mickey Outline Graphic, $, available at LululemonDisney x Lululemon Align™ High-Rise Pant 25", $, available at LululemonRhode Barrier ButterIt seems everything Hailey Bieber touches turns to gold, but how about butter? Rhode made its name with hydrating milks and peptide lip balms and now the brand has launched its thickest formula yet in the form of the Barrier Butter. An intensive moisturizer, the balm-like formula provides deep hydration for plump and glowing skin. Containing hyaluronic and polyglutamic acid, the buttery nighttime cream is all about locking in moisture and improving barrier function — perfect for chapped winter skin.Shop now at RhodeRhode Barrier Butter, $, available at RhodeFree People x Yellowstone With the Western trend still going strong, it only makes sense that Free People has partnered with the hit TV show Yellowstone for a limited-edition collection. The eight-piece We The Free capsule is full of Americana staples, including cowboy boots, bandanas, a cowboy hat, bootcut jeans, a suede jacket, and a graphic “Dutton Ranch” T-shirt with horses on it. Naturally, the campaign stars Yellowstone’s Kelsey Asbille and was shot on Dutton Ranch in Montana, where the Paramount+ series is filmed. The Free People x Yellowstone collection is available now, with prices ranging from $58 to $498.Shop now at Free PeopleFree People x Yellowstone Dutton Tee, $, available at Free PeopleFree People x Yellowstone Birch Belt, $, available at Free PeopleFree People x Yellowstone Flora Low-Rise Bootcut Jeans, $, available at Free PeopleFree People x Yellowstone Allistar Pointed Boots, $, available at Free People& Other Stories Fall Savoir CollectionA limited-edition seasonal collection, Savoir showcases the work of & Other Stories' atelier with a capsule of designer-inspired fashion. Embracing all things texture, the drop includes a series of metallic jacquard looks, including a tailored longline coat, a sculptural peplum top, tapered suit trousers, and a brocade evening bag. If shimmering gold isn’t your thing, the collection includes softer looks, too, with a mint ruffled gown; pearl-adorned, baby blue pumps; and a belted black blazer, ready for party season.Shop now at & Other Stories& Other Stories Ruffled Chiffon Midi Dress, $, available at & Other StoriesNoah x BarbourAfter a successful run, British heritage brand Barbour and NYC menswear label Noah have reunited for another collaboration, this one made up of three fall- and winter-ready jackets. For the collection, the Noah team dug into Barbour’s archives and reimagined popular styles from the ’80s. There’s the unisex Wool Bedale Jacket, which features a corduroy collar and is made with Casentino wool (a fuzzy fabric dating back to the 14th century); the Cotton Bedale, with the same silhouette but in a salt-washed cotton canvas; and the Border Jacket, a longer tweed style. “For this season’s Barbour collection, we stuck to the classic jacket shapes we’ve always loved from them,” Noah founder Brendon Babenzien said in a press release. “Barbour jackets, more than any other, have a timeless quality that allows them to get passed down from one generation to the next.” The Noah x Barbour collab is available to shop now.Shop now at Noah and BarbourNoah x Barbour Wool Teddy Bedale Jacket, $, available at NoahMerit Retrospect Extrait de ParfumMerit is well loved for its beautifully crafted makeup products and now the brand is expanding into the fragrance space with a vanilla and crisp pear perfume. Encased in a sculptural gold-topped bottle, the debut perfume has top notes of bergamot, heart notes of rosemary and jasmine, and base notes of moss and musk. Formulated as a highly concentrated extrait de parfum (with almost 30% fragrance oil), the scent promises a long wear of over 12 hours.Shop now at Merit BeautyMerit Retrospect L’Extrait de Parfum, $, available at MeritRouje x MissomaIn a romantic collaboration of Paris and London design, the new Rouje x Missoma jewelry collection is a color-lover’s dream. Our favorite looks in the capsule include a pair of ‘80s-inspired, oversized mosaic studs combining semi-precious blue, red, and green quartz with 18-carat recycled gold plating. The playful designs continue with a molten heart necklace featuring three gemstones on a velvet black choker. If you prefer to keep things classic, the collab includes a chunky gold domed ring with ridged detailing and matching vintage-inspired hoops.Shop now at MissomaRouje x Missoma Marisa Heart Pearl Stud Earrings, $, available at MissomaRixo Launches HomewareKnown for its retro aesthetic and vintage-inspired prints, fashion brand Rixo is taking the next step in its stylistic journey with the launch of its homeware range, Casa Rixo. Featuring abstract printed tablecloths, cushions, and napkins, the collection is available in two distinct colorways: a warm, Mediterranean-inspired terracotta and a blue-hued design with olive and peach accents. Made from linen and cotton blends, the statement homeware is R29 dinner party-approved.Shop now at RixoRIXO Zebe Linen and Cotton-Blend Tablecloth, $, available at RixoKate Somerville Goat Milk Body Lotion Sold as a duo with the iconic Goat Milk facial cleanser, the latest launch from Kate Somerville is a soothing body lotion. Famous for its ability to quench dry and sensitive skin instantly, the goat milk-based cream feels lightweight but is packed with proteins for deep nourishment. Alongside the star ingredient goat milk, it includes moisturizing jojoba and avocado oils, calming shea butter and Manuka honey (an ingredient believed to alleviate dry skin conditions like dermatitis). Shop now at Kate SomervilleKate Somerville Stressed Skin Saviors, $, available at Kate SomervilleMarc Jacobs x Wizard of OzThe arrival of Wicked on the big screen has us all reaching for emerald green attire or a fluffy pink ballgown, but Marc Jacobs is offering something a tad more sophisticated to coincide with the film’s release. Taking inspiration from the original Wizard of Oz, the collection includes totes, handbags and wallets with stills from the iconic movie, including imagery of the famed yellow brick road. For the biggest Dorothy fans around, the main event is a pair of diamanté-encrusted, crimson Mary Janes with a vertigo-inducing platform heel that makes the original ruby slippers look like running shoes.Shop now at Marc JacobsMarc Jacobs x The Wizard of Oz The Friends of Dorothy Leather Mini Compact Wallet, $, available at Marc JacobsHuda Beauty Icy Nude CollectionWith icy days on the horizon, we’ve got nothing but love for Huda Beauty’s latest frosty collection of cool-toned colors. Announced as the brand’s last foray into big eyeshadow palettes, the shades include a mix of mauve alongside a gunmetal glitter, pink shimmer and a snow-white matte. Branching beyond palettes, the collection also includes three new Faux Filter lipglosses (including an icy iridescent clear) and a ‘frostbitten’ face gloss that changes color with the pH of the skin. If frosty hues aren’t your thing, you can warm up with two new Blush Filters in deep Coco Loco and Latte.Shop now at Huda Beauty Huda Beauty Icy Nude Eyeshadow Palette, $, available at Huda BeautyLike what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?Refinery29 Loves: Everything To Shop In OctoberMango's Fall Collection Is As Trendy As It GetsShop Stanley x LoveShackFancy Collab Water Bottles

title: The Best Early Black Friday Fashion Deals - According to a Shopping Expert
description: Is there anything better than finding (read: falling in love with) a new handbag or trendy pair of sneakers, then discovering that the same product is also on sale at a fraction of its usual cost? Even after years of working as a shopping editor, I know firsthand that the "stars aligned" feeling of finding a dream style at the right price never really goes away - especially come Black Friday, when the season's most coveted wardrobe essentials are often marked down at their lowest prices of the year. While we're still a few weeks out from 2024's biggest shopping day, many retailers are getting in the holiday spirit early, with Black Friday sales that span the entire month of November and encompass a range of products. J.Crew is offering up to 50 percent off styles sitewide, including cozy sweaters and cardigans. Forever 21's early Black Friday sale is live, where shoppers can take 30 percent off trendy fashion staples - like faux-leather coats and evening bags. And even Amazon unveiled a bevy of new fashion markdowns on its bestselling clothing - including editor-loved bodysuits and Levi's jeans. Regardless of what you're in the market for, you can save big on it right now. Keep reading to shop our picks for the best early Black Friday fashion deals. Looking for something specific? Jump to our specific categories below: Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Bestsellers Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Tops and Sweaters Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Bottoms Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Dresses Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Winter Jackets Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Shoes Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Accessories Update on November 13, 2024 at TK: Updated prices and checked stock for all products. Looking for even more sales? Shop more of PS's Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals, and subscribe to our newsletter for more shopping recommendations.
author: Kyley Warren

title: The 15 Most Comfortable Walking Shoes
description: Having comfortable walking shoes incorporated into your wardrobe is a no-brainer, especially if you travel regularly or have an unbearably long commute to the office. When shopping for the best walking shoes, it's important to look for pairs that are versatile enough to keep you feeling both supported and chic, regardless of where your day takes you. We find that fashionable walking shoes are the perfect happy medium, because they not only look good with all of your favorite outfits, but they're also the exact type of shoe we want to slip into for a concert or when we're out exploring a new city. Alternatively, if you love to take long walks around the neighborhood or to your local coffee shop, it's essential that you have a great pair of stylish walking shoes on hand. It's not always easy to find the best of both worlds with style and comfort, but we're here to make it possible. Ahead, we rounded up the most comfortable walking shoes that'll look great with all your outfits, from sleek trousers to stretchy, sculpting leggings - and they'll also give your feet the support they need for long excursions. Whether you're looking for the best sneakers for walking, are in the market for a pair of classic white sneakers, or simply want to stock up on good shoes for walking all day, we have no doubt you'll be able to find your new favorite wardrobe essential here. Keep reading to shop our picks for the best shoes for walking and standing all day. These comfortable walking shoes are options you'll want to slip into time and time again.
author: Kyley Warren
